The first of these was Krenek’s Jonny spielt auf, which enjoyed an enormous vogue for a time. It seemed quite piquant to the provincial public of Germany that the hero of an opera should be a Negro jazz-band leader and that the composer should dare to introduce a few jazz tunes into his score.

库尔特·魏尔在一系列创造了前希特勒德国歌剧历史的作品中发展了这种普及趋势。他那个时期最具代表性的作品是《三便士歌剧》，剧本由伯特·布莱希特创作。魏尔公然用“歌曲”代替咏叹调，用伪爵士乐队代替通常的歌剧管弦乐队，他创作的音乐如此平庸陈腐，以至于不久之后每个德国报童都会吹着它。但是，他的作品与Jonny spielt auf不同之处在于他创作的音乐真正有个性。它以音乐的形式深刻地表达了 20 世纪 20 年代的德国精神，以及乔治·格罗兹以残酷的坦率描绘的战后德国无可救药地解体和堕落。不要被魏尔的平庸所迷惑。如果我们能够读懂字里行间的意思，感受到隐藏在看似无忧无虑的品质之下的深刻悲剧，那么这是一种有目的、有意义的平庸。

Kurt Weill developed that popularizing tendency in a series that made opera history in pre-Hitler Germany. His most characteristic work of that period was the Three Penny Opera, with a telling libretto by Bert Brecht. Weill openly substituted “songs” for arias and a pseudo-jazz band for the usual opera orchestra and wrote a music so ordinary and trite that before long every German newsboy was whistling it. But what gives his work a distinction that Jonny spielt auf did not have was the fact that he wrote music of real character. It is a searing expression in musical terms of the German spirit of the 1920’s, the hopelessly disintegrated and degenerated postwar Germany that George Grosz painted with brutal frankness. Do not be fooled by Weill’s banality. It is a purposeful and meaningful banality if one can read between the lines, as it were, and sense the deep tragedy hidden in its seemingly carefree quality.

意大利裔美国作曲家吉安-卡洛·梅诺蒂在《领事》中再次展现了歌剧作为对社会场景的批判。这种趋势将持续多久尚难预测。但除非作曲家能够将他们的批判性思维普世化，并以有效的舞台戏剧形式呈现，否则将歌剧引入日常生活将毫无益处。

Opera as a comment on the social scene was once more demonstrated by the Italian-American composer Gian-Carlo Menotti in The Consul. How long this tendency will continue is difficult to prophesy. But unless composers are able to universalize their comment and present it in terms of effective stage drama, no good will have come from bringing opera closer to everyday life.

这篇关于现代歌剧的讨论如果不提及当代最多产的歌剧作曲家之一、法国人达律斯·米约将是不完整的。米约在这一领域最雄心勃勃的努力是他的歌剧《克里斯托弗·哥伦布》，这部宏伟壮观的作品曾在国外多次上演，但在我国却从未上演过。米约的作品时而激烈，时而抒情，他在《可怜的水手》 、《卡庞特拉的艾斯帖》、《胡亚雷斯与马克西米利安》和其他舞台作品中巧妙地运用了这两种特质。听听他的《歌剧女主角》中一段名为《祈祷》的唱片选段，可以很好地了解他的戏剧影响力。歌手和合唱团在一系列打击乐器的伴奏下有节奏地朗诵。其效果令人震撼，为未来的歌剧指明了新的、未知的可能性。

This discussion of modern opera would be incomplete without some mention of one of the most prolific of contemporary opera composers, the Frenchman Darius Milhaud. Milhaud’s most ambitious effort in this field has been his opera Christopher Columbus, a grandiose and spectacular affair which has had several productions abroad but none in this country. Milhaud can be violent and lyrical by turns, and he has used both qualities to good effect in The Poor Sailor, Esther of Carpentras, Juarez and Maximilian, and other stage works. A good idea of his dramatic power may be had from listening to an excerpt available on records, from his Les Choephores, called Invocation. Singer and chorus rhythmically declaim to the accompaniment of a whole battery of percussion instruments. The effect is quite overwhelming and points to new, unplumbed possibilities for the opera of the future.

如果我的任何读者仍然怀疑现代歌剧，或者更确切地说，怀疑整个戏剧音乐的可行性，我请他们考虑一下这个最终事实。在新音乐发展史上，有三部被证明是里程碑的作品，都是为舞台创作的作品。穆索尔斯基的《鲍里斯》、德彪西的《佩利亚斯》以及斯特拉文斯基的《春之祭》都为音乐的发展做出了贡献。下一步的发展很可能发生在剧院，而不是音乐厅。

If any of my readers still doubt the viability of modern opera or, for that matter, theatrical music in general, I ask them to consider this final fact. Three of the works that proved to be milestones in the development of new music were works designed for the stage. Moussorgsky’s Boris, Debussy’s Pelléas , and Stravinsky’s Rite of Spring have all contributed to the advance of music. It may very well be that the next step forward will be made in the theater rather than the concert hall.

美国歌剧，或者更确切地说，美国歌剧，仍然存在一个问题。一些作家提出了一个理论，认为电影在美国舞台上取代歌剧是理所当然的，而且这种理论很有道理。在他们看来，歌剧是典型的欧洲艺术表现形式，不应移植到美国本土。但从作曲家的角度来看，无论从哪个角度来看，歌剧仍然是一种令人着迷的形式。如果歌剧要真正成功地移植到美国，必须满足两个条件：作曲家必须能够将英语谱写成优美的旋律，且不破坏英语的自然节奏；而且，歌剧的演出数量必须比目前在美国更多。事实上，一些最健康的本土歌剧，例如汤姆森-斯坦的《三幕四圣》或马克·布利茨斯坦的《摇篮将摇》，都是在没有成熟歌剧机构支持的情况下登上舞台的。或许，美国歌剧的未来就在歌剧院之外。但无论如何，我确信，无论在国内还是国外，我们都还没有听到过这种形式的最后一次。

There still remains the question of opera in America or, to be more exact, American opera. Some of our writers have advanced the theory, with a good deal of reason, that the movies legitimately take the place of opera in the American scene. To them, opera is a typically European manifestation of art, not to be transplanted to American soil. But from the composer’s standpoint, the opera is still a fascinating form, no matter how one looks at it. If it is to be transplanted with any chance of real success, two things must happen: Composers must be able to set English to a melodic line that does not falsify the natural rhythm of the language; and opera performances will have to be more numerous than they are at present in our country. As a matter of fact, some of the healthiest of native operatic ventures, such as the Thomson-Stein Four Saints in Three Acts or Marc Blitzstein’s The Cradle Will Rock, found their way on to the stage without benefit of an established opera organization. Perhaps the future of American opera lies outside the opera house. But in any event, I feel sure we have not heard the last of the form, either here or abroad.

 

 

注：所有这些歌剧也都有录像带和 DVD

Note: all of these operas are also available on videotape and DVD
